docs.title: Team 5152 Robot Code Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the comprehensive documentation for Team 5152's robot code. This documentation provides an in-depth look at our robot's sophisticated control and automation systems.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The characterization commands provide system identification capabilities for the swerve drive subsystem. These commands enable precise measurement and calculation of critical system parameters.

docs.title: Required Subsystems
docs.text: • SwerveDriveSubsystem

docs.title: WheelRadiusCharacterization
docs.text: Measures and calculates the effective wheel radius of the swerve modules.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: • swerveDriveSubsystem: The SwerveDrive subsystem instance to characterize

docs.title: Output
docs.text: Provides: - Wheel radius measurement in meters and inches - Wheel and gyro delta measurements - Calculation confidence metrics

docs.title: FeedforwardCharacterization
docs.text: Determines the feedforward characterization constants for the drive motors.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: • swerveDriveSubsystem: The SwerveDrive subsystem instance to characterize

docs.title: Output
docs.text: Provides: - kS (static friction coefficient) - kV (velocity coefficient) - Data points for validation

docs.title: Configuration Requirements
docs.text:
• Clear operating space required
  • Robot must be on a level surface
  • Battery should be fully charged
  • Robot must start in a known orientation

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: For detailed API documentation, see the Characterization Commands Javadoc

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The DefaultDrive command implements the default driving behavior for the SwerveDrive subsystem. This command provides real-time velocity control based on driver inputs through the DriveCalculator utility.

docs.title: Required Subsystems
docs.text: • SwerveDriveSubsystem

docs.title: Constructor Parameters
docs.text: • swerveDriveSubsystem: The SwerveDrive subsystem instance this command will control

docs.title: Configuration Requirements
docs.text:
• No additional configuration required beyond SwerveDrive subsystem configuration in TunerConstants
  • Command uses drive calculations from SwerveDrive subsystem's configured settings

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: For detailed API documentation, see the DefaultDrive Javadoc

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The DriveFacingAngle command implements sophisticated angle-controlled driving capabilities, allowing the robot to maintain a specific heading while moving. This command utilizes a ProfiledPIDController for precise angle management.

docs.title: Required Subsystems
docs.text: • SwerveDriveSubsystem

docs.title: Constructor Parameters
docs.text:
• swerveDriveSubsystem: The SwerveDrive subsystem instance this command will control
  • targetRotation: A supplier that provides the target rotation angle

docs.title: Configuration Requirements
docs.text: The following must be configured in TunerConstants: - PID values for angle control - Maximum angular velocity and acceleration constraints - Profile constraints for smooth angle transitions

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: For detailed API documentation, see the DriveFacingAngle Javadoc

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The DriveFacingPose command implements advanced pose-relative driving capabilities, automatically orienting the robot to face a target position while maintaining normal drive control. This command utilizes sophisticated geometry calculations and PID control for precise orientation management.

docs.title: Required Subsystems
docs.text: • SwerveDriveSubsystem

docs.title: Constructor Parameters
docs.text:
• swerveDriveSubsystem: The SwerveDrive subsystem instance this command will control
  • targetPose: A supplier that provides the target Pose2d to face towards

docs.title: Configuration Requirements
docs.text: The following must be configured in TunerConstants: - PID values for angle control - Maximum angular velocity and acceleration constraints - Profile constraints for smooth angle transitions

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: For detailed API documentation, see the DriveFacingPose Javadoc

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: The SwerveDrive subsystem is a sophisticated drive system that enables omnidirectional movement of the robot. It manages four swerve modules (each containing drive and turn motors), handles odometry calculations, and provides autonomous path-following capabilities.

docs.title: Commands that use the subsystem
docs.text:
• DefaultDrive Command: Provides standard teleoperated control
  • DriveFacingAngle Command: Maintains a specific robot heading while driving
  • DriveFacingPose Command: Orients the robot to face a target position while driving
  • Characterization Commands: Used for system identification and calibration

docs.title: Hardware Requirements
docs.text:
1. Four Swerve Drive Modules (Front Left, Front Right, Back Left, Back Right)
    • Each module requires:
      • Drive motor with encoder
      • Turn motor with absolute encoder
  2. Gyroscope (NavX, Pigeon, or similar IMU)

docs.title: Configuration in TunerConstants
docs.text:
All configuration is handled through TunerConstants, including: - Module configurations (gear ratios, conversions, PID values) - PathPlanner settings - Holonomic drive controller settings - Module positions and dimensions - Maximum velocity and acceleration limits - Drive characterization values (kS, kV, kA) - Wheel radius parameters - Absolute encoder offsets

See the JavaDoc Reference for detailed configuration options.

docs.title: Additional Notes
docs.text:
• Odometry updates run on a separate high-frequency thread
  • Vision measurements can be incorporated for pose estimation
  • Supports both teleop and autonomous operation
  • PathPlanner integration for autonomous path following
  • Built-in system identification capabilities for tuning
